channel.title: Gearwire Crosstalk
channel.itunes:subtitle: News. Wild Speculation. Live Gear Reviews.
channel.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
channel.itunes:summary: Gearwire Crosstalk is the music-maker's source for gear news, how-tos, and live, in-depth reviews. Tune into Gearwire Crosstalk.
channel.description: Gearwire Crosstalk is the music-maker's source for gear news, how-tos, and live, in-depth reviews. Tune into Gearwire Crosstalk each week -- a new episode every week.

item.title: Crosstalk 50 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Crosstalk 50: We've Got A T-Bone To Pick
item.itunes:summary: Here's your main course, folks. Crosstalk 50 is chock-full of meaty discourse on VST hosts, T-Bone Burnett's secret audio encoding format (it's 1,000 island dressing) and "HiDef" digital audio. Oh, and let's not forget The Coug (leaner than bison).
item.itunes:keywords: t-bone burnett, muse receptor, vst host, v-machine, gearwire crosstalk, crosstalk

item.title: Crosstalk 49 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Crosstalk 49: Britton And Force One Seven Throw Down
item.itunes:summary: The latest episode of Crosstalk features an interview with one of Chicago's fastest-rising and youngest hip-hop and RnB producers, Nael Shehade from Force One Seven. We pick his brain about his gear and production methods.
item.itunes:keywords: crosstalk, gearwire crosstalk, force one seven, hip hop, r and b, producer, interview, ez, reason, cubase, mpc1000

item.title: Crosstalk 48 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Crosstalk 48: Nursing Our Summer NAMM Hangover Headache
item.itunes:summary: Now that Bill's applied enough aloe vera to his sunburn, and Britton's -- uhh -- recovered, we've decided to take one last look at the Summer NAMM product debuts that may have been eclipsed in the standard GW news cycle by the mighty Moog Guitar.
item.itunes:keywords: summer namm, namm, summer namm 2008, roland, ibanez, juno stage, boss, slicer, v-drums, toby keith, crostalk, gearwire

item.title: Crosstalk 47 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Crosstalk 47: Sum Sum Summer NAMM, Sum Sum Summer NAMM, SUMMER NAAAAAAAMM
item.itunes:summary: For about two weeks, we thought the HVAC system in the Gearwire offices was busted, but it turns out it's just hot because Summer NAMM 2008 is here! Covered: Moog Guitar and other, non-Moog-Guitar products.
item.itunes:keywords: crosstalk, summer namm, namm, namm 2008, korg, moog, ibanez, moog guitar

item.title: Crosstalk 46 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Crosstalk 46: Let's Start At The Very Beginning (Of The Signal Path)
item.itunes:summary: Microphones: another expansive topic for the Crosstalk gang, perhaps, but a short bullet-point primer from Britton serves as good jumping off point for a discussion on general microphone use, and some not-so-common mic applications.
item.itunes:keywords: Crosstalk 46, Crosstalk, microphones, condenser, dynamic, ribbon mic, pzm, shure, neumann, akg, sennheiser, rode, audix, samson, mics, mxl, behringer

item.title: Crosstalk 45 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Crosstalk 45 Plugs In To Plugins
item.itunes:summary: Gearwire Crosstalk focuses on the incredibly immense field of VST instruments and plugins. The gang compares plugins to analog equipment and the use of plugins to the use of the actual instrument.
item.itunes:keywords: Crosstalk 45, Crosstalk, VST Plugins, VST, Plugins, MIDI, CV

item.title: Crosstalk 44 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Black Metal And Outsourcing Are Killing America
item.itunes:summary: What do dropped-C tuning and audio equipment production outsourcing have in common? They're both discussed on episode 44 of Crosstalk! As Kierkegaard said: "both production outsourcing and Norwegian Black Metal are reprehensible, but necessary evils." Or was that Dick Van Patten?
item.itunes:keywords: crosstalk, krk, outsourcing, black metal riff off, riff off, contest, ampeg, vox, reverend, fender, gibson, epiphone, korg, loud

item.title: Crosstalk 43 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill, Henry, Britton And Owen On Vintage Fetishism
item.itunes:summary: So many things get better with age -- cheese, wine, George Clooney -- but did that Ibanez Blazer Bass really attain some magical quality once it hit the two-decade mark? Crosstalk discusses the liberal use of the "vintage" tag and its implications.
item.itunes:keywords: crosstalk, vintage, used gear, ebay, craigslist, gear fetish, fender, marshall, vox, guitar, synth, recording, neumann, delorean

item.title: Crosstalk 42 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Beating Dead Horses With Bob Mothersbaugh
item.itunes:summary: In Episode 42 of Crosstalk, the Crosstalk gang talks more about amp modeling, spurred on by an interview with Bob Mothersbaugh. Guess what? Britton still hates Line 6.
item.itunes:keywords: Crosstalk, Line 6, Modeling, Amp Modeling, Devo, Bob Mothersbaugh, Mothersbaugh

item.title: Crosstalk 41 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Musikmesse Review
item.itunes:summary: In Episode 41 of Crosstalk, Bill almost strangles Britton for excessive use of a vocoder, Musikmesse proves once again to be the greatest show on Earth and the guys finally get to talk about custom analog synths.
item.itunes:keywords: Crosstalk, musical gear, musikmesse, custom analog synth, guitar, bass, double neck

item.title: Crosstalk 40 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill, Owen, Henry and Britton Level Their Opinion Cannons On The Lo-Fi Movement
item.itunes:summary: Crosstalk concentrates on discussing the difference between lo-fi and poor quality
item.itunes:keywords: Crosstalk, musical gear, lo-fi, guitar, bass, double neck

item.title: Crosstalk 39 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill, Henry and Owen Dish On Their Home Recording Experiences
item.itunes:summary: Crosstalk focuses on home recording and the crew shares experiences before suggesting what to start your rig with if you're on a budget
item.itunes:keywords: home recording, monitor, DAW, tracking, recording, computer recording, Crosstalk

item.title: Crosstalk 38 (mp3)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Bashing Something That Deserves It -- Guitar Hero
item.itunes:summary: Crosstalk moves to audio format and talks about what went down at Winter NAMM 2008
item.itunes:keywords: NAMM show, trade show, new products, musical gear, Guitar Hero, crosstalk, gear

item.title: Crosstalk 36 (Quicktime High Video)
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Crosstalk In Complete Barbershop Harmonization
item.itunes:summary: Crosstalk takes a look at the DigiTech Vocalist Live 4 and discusses vocal effects
item.itunes:keywords: vocals, processing, effects, harmonization, pitch correction, crosstalk, gear

item.title: 013 (video) - Freeware softsynth demos!
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also KORG KAOSPAD 3, Summer NAMM coverage of Fender Princeton Recording Amp, Numark iDJ2, Electro-Harmonix HOG
item.itunes:summary: Must be lucky episode 13: Gearwire Crosstalk goes video!!!! Mike, Dan, and Britton speculate on the next generation of touchpad madness with the announcement of the Korg KAOSSPAD 3. Next, three of the videos from our Summer NAMM expedition are previewed and discussed. We finish off with our first in a series of looks into free and donationware plugins.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production, gearcast, gearwire

item.title: 011 - MOTU Ethno Instrument in-studio review
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also Roger Nichols plugins, Redisents sell blank CDs
item.itunes:summary: This week Gearwire Crosstalk goes to 11. Britton gets replaced by a sampler. The crew speculates on the new line of audiophiley plugins from Roger Nichols. Giant eyeball band The Residents pushes the digital distribution envelope by, er, selling blank CDs to fans. MOTU's Ethno Instrument gets the treatment in this week's in-studio review.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production, gearcast, gearwire

item.title: 010 - Arturia Analog Factory, Moogerfoogers
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also M-Audio MidAir, Guyatone ULTRON and ULTREM
item.itunes:summary: This week the crew speculates on M-Audio's new wireless MIDI keyboard controller and a fancy-lookin' pair of tap-tempo stomp boxes from Guyatone. They also get sound from Arturia's new Analog Factory softsynth bundle and an unholy conglomeration of Moogerfoogers.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production, gearcast, gearwire

item.title: 009 - Copyright and digital music distribution
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also Music piracy sites, DiMA lobbies for licensing changes, Tunecore.com
item.itunes:summary: A special edition of Gearwire Crosstalk covering issues of copyright and digital music distribution.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production, gearcast, gearwire

item.title: 008 - Native Instruments Kore in-studio demo
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also Line 6 Bass Model Pack
item.itunes:summary: Line 6 releases Bass Model Pack, the latest in the company's line of downloadable software updates that add new functionality to the venerable PODXT and PODXT Pro. (As a bonus, Britton reveals his true feelings toward modeling amps.) Next up, Native Instruments product specialist Joshua Fielstra takes us deep into the Kore. Learn about the options and hear some of the sounds that Kore brings to your wavetable.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production, gearcast, gearwire

item.title: 007 - Hollowbody shootout: Ibanez, Gretsch, Rickenbacker
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also Ashdown Fallen Angel, Digi Music Production Toolkit LE, PreSonus Faderport and FireStudio, Waves GTR
item.itunes:summary: In episode seven, the team speculates on Ashdown's Fallen Angel DSP amps, Broadjam's DIY Web service for musicians, Digidesign's Music Production Toolkit for LE, and the Faderport and FireStudio DAW thingamajigs from PreSonus. This week's shootout: hollowbody electric guitars, featuring two Ibanezes, a Gretsch, and a Rickenbacker.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production, gearcast, gearwire

item.title: 006 - Wah pedal shootout: Weeping Demon, Crybaby, 535Q, Boss V-Wah
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also Ampeg SVX plugins, SSL Duende
item.itunes:summary: This week, the team speculates on the release of Ampeg and IK Multimedia new bass amp and effects simulators--can they fit that huge Ampeg sound into your computer? A totally deep discussion on the SSL Duende firewire DSP unit follows--can ones and zeroes really deliver that certain something that SSL's do so well, and for relatively cheap?
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production, gearcast, gearwire

item.title: 005 - Looper pedal shootout: Boomerang+, Boss RC-20XL, Gibson Echoplex
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also RME Micstasy, Muse Receptor, trouble for E-H tubes?
item.itunes:summary: This week, the Crosstalk crew attempts to unravel the mysterious gain reduction technology on RME's new Micstasy preamp/converter. Then they wade into the murky waters of geopolitics, pondering whether tube manufacturing in Russia will turn end up MIA thanks in part to the KGB, leaving tube enthusiasts SOL.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production

item.title: 004 - Save money making music
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Tips for tight-wads: used gear, mods, room treatments, free software, audio school or not, music promotion
item.itunes:summary: In this special edition of Gearwire Crosstalk, our panelists share penny-pinching tips for recording and promoting your music--without having to eat Ramen every night of the week.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production

item.title: 003 - Distortion pedal shootout: Behringer VD-1, Ibanez TS9, Damage Control Womanizer, Demonizer
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also NI Kore, Edirol R-09, Roland HPD-10
item.itunes:summary: Mike, Drew, Britton, and Dan attempt to peel back the layers of enigma surrounding Native Instruments Kore Universal Sound Platform. They also review the Edirol R-09 and Roland Handsonic HPD-10. Plus there's a distortion stomp box shootout!
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production

item.title: 002 - Fender TC90, TC Electronic G System
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also Focusrite Liquid Mix, TC Electronic TC Konnekt 24D
item.itunes:summary: This week the Gearwire Crosstalk clan discusses the Moog Little Phatty's big sales, the new Focusrite Liquid Mix, the TC Electronic Konnekt 24D, and reviews the Fender TC90 and the TC Electronic G System.
item.itunes:keywords: guitar, musician, pro audio, music gear, musical instruments, music equipment, recording, audio production, music production

item.title: 001 - RME Fireface 800
item.itunes:author: Gearwire.com
item.itunes:subtitle: also Moog Little Phatty, Korg PadKONTROL
item.itunes:summary: Mike, Drew, Britton, and Dan do the news, engage in wild speculation, and fire off some gear reviews
